spiops package¶

spiops.spiops module¶

spiops.spiops.cov_ck_ker(ck, support_ker, object='ALL', time_format='UTC', report=False, unload=False)[source]¶

Provides time coverage summary for a given object for a given CK file. Several options are available. This function is based on the following SPICE API:

http://naif.jpl.nasa.gov/pub/naif/toolkit_docs/C/cspice/ckcov_c.html

The NAIF utility CKBRIEF can be used for the same purpose.

Parameters:
  • ck – CK file to be used
  • support_ker (Union[str, list]) – Support kernels required to run the function. At least it should be a leapseconds kernel (LSK) and a Spacecraft clock kernel (SCLK) optionally a meta-kernel (MK) which is highly recommended
  • object (str) – Ephemeris Object to obtain the coverage from
  • time_format (str) – Output time format; it can be ‘UTC’, ‘CAL’ (for TDB in calendar format) or ‘TDB’. Default is ‘TDB’
  • global_boundary (bool) – Boolean to indicate whether if we want all the coverage windows or only the absolute start and finish coverage times
  • report (bool) – If True prints the resulting coverage on the screen
  • unload (bool) – If True it will unload the input meta-kernel
Returns:

Returns a list with the coverage intervals
Return type:

list
spiops.spiops.cov_ck_obj(mk, object, time_format='UTC', global_boundary=False, report=False, unload=False)[source]¶

Provides time coverage summary for a given object for a list of binary CK files provided in a meta-kernel. Several options are available. This function is based on the following SPICE API:

http://naif.jpl.nasa.gov/pub/naif/toolkit_docs/C/cspice/ckcov_c.html

The NAIF utility CKBRIEF can be used for the same purpose.

Parameters:
  • mk (str) – Meta-kernel to load the computation scenario
  • object (str) – Ephemeris Object to obtain the coverage from
  • time_format (str) – Output time format; it can be ‘UTC’, ‘CAL’ (for TDB in calendar format) or ‘TDB’. Default is ‘TDB’
  • global_boundary (bool) – Boolean to indicate whether if we want all the coverage windows or only the absolute start and finish coverage times
  • report (bool) – If True prints the resulting coverage on the screen
  • unload (bool) – If True it will unload the input meta-kernel
Returns:

Returns a list with the coverage intervals
Return type:

list
spiops.spiops.cov_spk_ker(spk, support_ker, object='ALL', time_format='TDB', report=False, unload=False)[source]¶

Provides time coverage summary for a given object for a given SPK file. Several options are available. This function is based on the following SPICE API:

http://naif.jpl.nasa.gov/pub/naif/toolkit_docs/C/cspice/spkcov_c.html

The NAIF utility BRIEF can be used for the same purpose.

Parameters:
  • spk – SPK file to be used
  • support_ker (Union[str, list]) – Support kernels required to run the function. At least it should be a leapseconds kernel (LSK) and optionally a meta-kernel (MK)
  • object (str) – Ephemeris Object to obtain the coverage from
  • time_format (str) – Output time format; it can be ‘UTC’, ‘CAL’ (for TDB in calendar format) or ‘TDB’. Default is ‘TDB’
  • global_boundary (bool) – Boolean to indicate whether if we want all the coverage windows or only the absolute start and finish coverage times
  • report (bool) – If True prints the resulting coverage on the screen
  • unload (bool) – If True it will unload the input meta-kernel
Returns:

Returns a list with the coverage intervals
Return type:

list
spiops.spiops.cov_spk_obj(mk, object, time_format='TDB', global_boundary=False, report=False, unload=False)[source]¶

Provides time coverage summary for a given object for a list of binary SPK files provided in a meta-kernel. Several options are available. This function is based on the following SPICE API:

http://naif.jpl.nasa.gov/pub/naif/toolkit_docs/C/cspice/spkcov_c.html

The NAIF utility BRIEF can be used for the same purpose.

Parameters:
  • mk (str) – Meta-kernel to load the computation scenario
  • object (str) – Ephemeris Object to obtain the coverage from
  • time_format (str) – Output time format; it can be ‘UTC’, ‘CAL’ (for TDB in calendar format) or ‘TDB’. Default is ‘TDB’
  • global_boundary (bool) – Boolean to indicate whether if we want all the coverage windows or only the absolute start and finish coverage times
  • report (bool) – If True prints the resulting coverage on the screen
  • unload (bool) – If True it will unload the input meta-kernel
Returns:

Returns a list with the coverage intervals
Return type:

list
spiops.spiops.fov_illum(mk, sensor, time=None, angle='DEGREES', abcorr='LT+S', report=False, unload=False)[source]¶

Determine the Illumination of a given FoV (for light scattering computations for example). This function is based on the following SPICE APIs:

http://naif.jpl.nasa.gov/pub/naif/toolkit_docs/C/cspice/getfov_c.html http://naif.jpl.nasa.gov/pub/naif/toolkit_docs/C/cspice/spkezp_c.html

Parameters:
  • mk (str) – Meta-kernel to load the computation scenario
  • sensor (Union[str, int]) – Sensor ID code or name
  • time (Union[str, float]) – Time to compute the quantity
  • angle (str) – Angular unit; it can be ‘DEGREES’ or ‘RADIANS’. Default is ‘DEGREES’
  • abcorr (str) – Aberration correction. Default and recommended is ‘LT+S’
  • report (bool) – If True prints the resulting illumination angle on the screen
  • unload (bool) – If True it will unload the input meta-kernel
Returns:

Angle in between a sensor’s boresight and the sun-sc direction
Return type:

float

spiops.utils.time¶

spiops.utils.time.cov_int(object_cov, object_id, kernel, time_format='TDB', global_boundary=False, report=False)[source]¶

Generates a list of time windows out of a SPICE cell for which either the SPICE API spkcov_c or ckcov_c have been run.

Parameters:
  • object_cov – SPICE
  • object_id (Union[str, int]) – Object ID or Name for which we provide the coverage
  • kernel (str) – Kernel name for which the coverage is being checked
  • time_format (str) – Desired output format; ‘UTC’ or ‘CAL’
  • global_boundary (bool) – Boolean to indicate whether if we want all the coverage windows or only the absolute start and finish coverage times
  • report (bool) – If True prints the resulting coverage on the screen
Returns:

Time Windows in the shape of a list
Return type:

list
spiops.utils.time.et2cal(time, format='UTC')[source]¶

Converts Ephemeris Time (ET) into UTC or Calendar TDB (CAL) time. Accepts a single time or a lists of times. This function assumes that the support kernels (meta-kernel or leapseconds kernel has been loaded)

Parameters:
  • time (Union[float, list]) – Input ET time
  • format (str) – Desired output format; ‘UTC’ or ‘CAL’
Returns:

Output time in ‘UTC’, ‘CAL’ or ‘TDB’
Return type:

Union[str, list]
